lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The essay ''On the Eve of 2001, the Future Is Not Quite What It Used to Be,'' (Dec. 26) provides a thoughtful view of the predictive missteps versus the still valid questions raised by the classic film ''2001: A Space Odyssey.'' There is a key reason we have failed to approach anything like the activity in space portrayed by the film. The imperatives of the cold war Apollo effort created a ''command economy'' mindset for space inside and outside NASA that has crippled creative solutions to opening practical space access.
abstract: Dr Charles A Lurio on Dec 26 article on predictive missteps and still valid quesitions raised by film 2001: A Space Odyssey calls for low-cost ground and flight vehicle test program for durable rocket systems to spur space travel
